Title: Libxml2 URI Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow has been discovered in libxml2 versions prior to
    2.6.6 which may be exploited by an attacker allowing the execution of
    arbitrary code.

Description.Text: Yuuichi Teranishi discovered a flaw in libxml2 versions prior to 2.6.6. When the libxml2 library fetches a remote resource via FTP or HTTP, libxml2 uses parsing routines that can overflow a buffer caused by improper bounds checking if they are passed a URL longer than 4096 bytes.

Impact.Text: If an attacker is able to exploit an application using libxml2 that parses remote resources, then this flaw could be used to execute arbitrary code.

Workaround.Text: No workaround is available; users are urged to upgrade libxml2 to 2.6.6.

P.Text: All users are recommended to upgrade their libxml2 installation:
